Fields.DialogueText: *stretches*
Nothing better after a successful mission than some downtime, right?
I guess.

Fields.MenuText: Someone doesn't sound too happy.
Don't tell me... you hate downtime.
I'm going to ignore your tone and focus on enjoying the break.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not. I'm bored.
No, really? What was your first clue?
Don't ignore me, I'm sulking here!
I just don't think that we deserve a break, is all. That mission was way too easy. I'm ready for the next one.
Has anyone ever told you to be careful what you wish for?
Nope, I can honestly say I've never been told that.
Really? That's actually surprising. With your personality, you should be hearing it constantly.
Rude. And up until a little while ago, I was a ship. That's not really something people say to ships. But, I bet you've never had a bottle broken on your head.
You got me there.
Thought so. Now can we take a break from this break and find some Morganas to trounce.
I guess that's better than getting rusty.
@BATTLE
Hey, boss!
Oh, Supreme Power of the Ship...
Give me something to do! I'm tired of sitting on my hands!

Fields.MenuText: Supreme power? I hope you're not trying to talk to God.
St. Louis, keep it down. Some people are happy to just sit here overlooked.
You realize you sound like a child right now, right?

Fields.DialogueText: At this point, I'll take any mission, even a holy one.
If you're one of those people, I should be asking for a new captain, too.
No, a child would sound like this: Give. Me. A. Jooooooooob!
If you don't give me a mission soon then I'm just gonna leave and find my own!
We both know that's an empty threat.
Well... I'll just be really pissed off then! Like even more than I am now!
All right, can we bring it down now? The admiral isn't here, but I'm pretty sure everyone else in the base is staring at you.
Hmph, fine. I'll try again tomorrow.
Ehh, let's put a pin in that. Maybe a little Morgana hunting will bring your spirits up.
*shrugs* I guess it's worth a try.
@BATTLE
... Carry on.
I hear someone's been looking for me.
You're not the only one. Everyone can hear her.
Well, hopefully I've got some good news for her. Maybe it'll keep her quiet for a while longer.
Did somebody say good news?

Fields.MenuText: Jeez, where did you come from?
She's here now, so I hope you can make her happy, Admiral.
What did I say about putting your ear against my door?

Fields.DialogueText: I hear my name and I come running. I'm awesome that way.
You heard the Captain - give me the happiness! Please. Admiral.
I didn't. You two just talk loud.
Well, I'm glad you're here now. I've got your new mission right here.
Oh, and it's in a manila folder. How official.
I'm not expecting dragons, I just want a little more excitement.
I think you'll be happy with this. We're sending you to Hawaii.
Hawaii? What's the catch?
Bleh, Hawaii? Why? I wanted excitement, not a vacation hotspot.
*ALARM*
How's that for excitement?
*sigh* I guess I oughta enjoy while I've got it.
@BATTLE
I don't believe we actually said your name.
Eh, semantics.
All right, make sure we're fully stocked on ammo, fuel, and all other necessities.
Yeah, necessities like beach balls, and towels, and suntan lotion, and everything else we need for our little beach trip.
Whee.

Fields.MenuText: And sunscreen, and smoothies, and you can't forget sunglasses.
I really hope you're just messing around. You don't actually think this is going to be a vacation, do you?
If you're so against this mission, I can do it without you.

Fields.DialogueText: Stop it, Cap, it's not as much fun when you help.
I do. No one goes to Hawaii for anything other than vacation. The only Morganas we're gonna run into are gonna be working on their tan.
No, you can't. I come with the ship. Unfortunately.
You know, the admiral picked us specifically for this.
Really? And here I was thinking he liked us. What a jerk.
No, he's under the impression our... tactical strengths might be needed.
Suuuure. We'll be able to lay out the beach towels perfectly.
*ALARM*
You hear that? That's the sound of actual excitement. If that alarm goes off while we're in Hawaii, I'll pay you a hundred dollars.
Pft, like you have a hundred dollars.
@BATTLE
Everything looks shipshape around here. You should be good to go soon, right?
Shipshape. Hah hah, very funny.
We should be on our way before long. We're just now finishing up.
Seriously, Admiral? Did I do something to piss you off? I'm sorry, I'll never do it again, I swear.
St. Louis, I don't know what you're so upset about.
You're sending us off to Hawaii so you won't ever have to deal with us again. It's just a bunch of busywork.
I don't know where you got that idea. The Hawaiian islands are our least guarded area. They'd be the easiest place for our enemies to attack and the hardest for us to defend.
If they're attacked without anyone positioned there, the battle would be over before we could send reinforcements.
Hmmmm, when you put it that way it does sound kind of important.

Fields.MenuText: More than kind of. You don't want to be responsible for losing Hawaii to the Morganas, do you?
Is that the sound of St. Louis admitting she was wrong?
But don't get me wrong, I'm gonna make time for suntanning too.

Fields.DialogueText: Whoa, that's huge actually. It's like we're on the frontlines.
Shut up. I wasn't wrong. I just wasn't right.
*raspberry* Of course you. Why am I not surprised?
So do you feel better now?
Yeah, I guess I kind of do. This could turn out to be an awesome assignment.
*ALARM*
Oh, good tidings. Let's go, Captain, we've got Morganas waiting for their butt kickings.
@BATTLE
Ummmm, St. Louis, what's this line for?
*sigh*
The crew wanted to pat my head for good luck. At least this way they're not crowding me like an angry mob.

Fields.MenuText: I thought you didn't like them treating you like a good luck charm.
This is a pretty long line. Is there anyone actually operating the ship?
So if I want to pat your head I have to wait in line for an hour now?

Fields.DialogueText: At this point I'm just glad they're not making key chains out of my hair.
Don't worry, Cap - they come in waves. Once these guys are finished they'll swap out, and it'll start all over again.
Yup, looks like it. Sucks to be you.
Hmmm, now that I think about it, maybe I should start charging.
That would be one way to make everyone stop.
Hey, you saying I'm not lucky enough for a couple bucks?
What, now you're buying into this lucky charm thing?
Maybe. I mean, you can't argue with results.
*ALARM*
If you were really lucky then we wouldn't be running into so many Morganas.
I think you and I have different definitions of the word lucky.
@BATTLE
Hey, do you think planes have spirits too?
What?
I mean, like, Belles are the spirits of warships, do you think there are spirits in other things too?

Fields.MenuText: That kind of came out of the blue there, St. Louis.
I'm not so sure. It sounds a little crazy to me.
Could be. It doesn't sound any more farfetched than everything else I've seen.

Fields.DialogueText: Not really. I've been thinking about it for a while.
Crazier than Morganas eating ships and plaguing the seas?
You say that like you've seen everything.
I wish I was a plane instead of a ship.
I'm happy you're a ship. Our whole crew wouldn't fit in an itty-bitty plane.
Well, we wouldn't need a whole crew. We could just fly right over the sea from coast to coast.
I think you might be giving me too much credit.
I think you might be underestimating my aerial navigation abilities.
... You're a ship.
*ALARM*
But if I was a plane, we could just fly right over these Morganas!
I'll give you that one.
@BATTLE
Thinking and saying are two different things.
You make a fair point.
No. No way. I'm still waiting for the day I can listen to the radio on the go.
Captain, we have Morganas fast approaching from our rear.
Wait, then why are we stopping?
Uhhh, St. Louis ordered us--
St. Louis? I should've known. I'm your captain. You should know better.
Did I hear my name again?

Fields.MenuText: I'm the captain. I give the orders, St. Louis.
You better have a good reason for stopping.
Don't tell me you joined the dark side.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm St. Louis, and I ignore your orders sometimes, Captain.
I do. If we don't stop then I can't do my plan.
Dark side? What are you talking about? Make sense already.
I just hope you have a plan.
Of course I do. We're gonna stop so we can blow them up when we see the whites of their eyes.
That's not a plan.
Do Morgana eyes even have white parts? Huh, I guess I'll find out soon.
And you're not even listening to me.
@BATTLE
St. Louis, running in headfirst is not an appropriate tactic.
Yeah, yeah, running in headfirst is not an appropriate tactic.
When you act that way it's like you have no regard for your own safety.
When I act that way it's like I have no regard for my own safety.
Are you even listening to me?
Am I even listening to you?

Fields.MenuText: Okay, I get it, you don't like what I'm saying. But it's important.
Do you want to die? Because I know my crew would rather not blow up in a fiery explosion.
I'm St. Louis, but I look more like a St. Bernard.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, you keep saying that, but we're still alive, ain't we?
I'm not gonna die. We're not gonna die. Calm down.
I'm St. Louis, but I look more like a St. Bernard... Wait a minute... Rude!
Look, if it would make you stop yelling at me, I can promise to... *sigh* think before I act. Happy?
You know, I am your captain. It's not that preposterous to expect you to follow my orders.
Oh, oh you want me to follow your orders? That's it? *shakin' her head, rolling her eyes* Can we just fight some Morganas or something now. (While I suppress the urge to strangle you.)
I'm sorry, what was that?
I feel like I might've just made a mistake.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
St. Louis, I'm coming in, hope you're decent.
Wait, wait, stop, ah, ugh! *tumbles and crashes*
Ummm... were you trying to hide that massive photo of... some guy?
Some guy? Excuse you, that is Charles Lindbergh, he's not just some guy, that's THE guy.

Fields.MenuText: I might regret asking you this, but who's Charles Lindbergh?
I'm actually more curious about how you got such a massive poster.
If anyone is the guy, it's me.

Fields.DialogueText: It's like you don't know anything important. Not only is he dreamy, but he's the first man to fly nonstop across the Atlantic. And guess what he flew in. A plane named The Spirit of St. Louis. Boom.
Why? Do you have someone you want a giant photograph of on your wall? Maybe me? I wouldn't blame you, I'm so adorable.
Please, you're not even close to the anything. You gotta work a little harder if you want that legendary status.
Now, if you would please leave and give me a moment to cover all this up, I'd greatly appreciate it.
Okay, I don't really understand why you've got to hide it, but whatever.
It's a secret crush. Now go, scat!
Yeah, cuz that's what you do with secrets. Tell me about them before you hide them.
*ALARM*
You know what that means, right?
Ugh, just gimme a minute!
Fine, take all the time in the world. I'll just be fighting Morganas in the meantime.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
St. Louis, step it up!
*yawn* ...

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry, is the ship under fire too boring for you?
Do you know something I don't know or something?
Are we having a staring contest right now? I feel like we're having a staring contest right now.

Fields.DialogueText: Actually it's quite exciting, sir, yes, sir.
I don't know anything you don't know, sir, no, sir.
Sir, that would be a contest I would clearly lose. You obviously have superior staring abilities, sir.
Okay, is now really the best time to be mocking military standards? We've got Morganas to fight.
*BOOM*
Yeah, it sounds like it.
Why aren't you moving then?
I'm waiting for your order. Isn't that what you wanted?
Oh lord, you have the worst timing.
*angry puppy scowl*
How about a quick apology now and then we blow off the rest of that steam while we take care of this situation.
... I'm waiting.
I'm sorry.
*BOOM*
All right, let's go! I hope you've learned a lesson, Captain.
Honestly? Nope.
@BATTLE
Hey, so what specifically is our mission in Hawaii?
You didn't read the file, did you?
I started to. But then it got boring. And I mean real boring. I took a nap instead.

Fields.MenuText: How far did you get?
Well, then I guess you didn't get to the part about the dragon slaying leprechaun we're hunting on the island of Dodongolua.
You're not wrong. Reading files doesn't an adventure make.

Fields.DialogueText: First paragraph. It lost me with all the big words. And I know big words, I like big words, but these were big boring words.
I wish! Now that would be an exciting mission. But I know there are no such things as leprechauns. And a dragon would eat one in an instant anyway.
Why are you talking backwards? Are you trying to sound wise or something? It ain't working.
*sigh* Basically we're just going to patrol the waters around each island for a while. We'll receive a message when they want us to return. Probably when they think it's safe.
So it's like a indefinite vacation? Yeah, no wonder reading about it didn't catch my interest.
You know, you really shouldn't give up on reading so quickly.
What? I read all the time. Every night before I go to bed I read a few chapters of Twain.
Mark Twain?
No, Terry Twain, the other famous Twain author... Yes, Mark Twain.
Sorry, you don't tear me a new one. I just didn't think that you'd like Mark Twain.
*ALARM*
I'll be offended by that later. For now, we've got Morganas to deal with.
@BATTLE
Step up and challenge Lady Luck, herself. Test your luck against hers. Winner take all!
*crowd muttering*
What's all this?
*crowd exclamation*
That's right, you unlucky punks, no one's got nothing on all this!
Who's next, who's next? Who is brave enough to match their fortune up against hers?

Fields.MenuText: This looks interesting. I guess I'll give it a go.
You wanna explain what all this ruckus is about this time?
If there was ever a time for a Morgana to appear, it would be now.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, Captain...
Oh, Captain...
Oh, Captain...
I was really hoping all this lucky nonsense wouldn't get to your head.
I don't actually think I'm super lucky, they just all do. I'm simply taking advantage of that for fun and profit.
When did you get so schemy?
Well, I had to find some way to occupy my time when we stopped running into Morganas so much.
Then I guess we better go find some Morganas. If only to spare the crew their wages.
@BATTLE
*crowd disperses*
Are you... are you serious?
*crowd disperses*
Um... we're just playing?
I was under the impression everything was a game to you, St. Louis.
*crowd disperses*
That is a horrible thing to wish for, Captain. Especially on lil' ol' me.
Captain, we've got a problem.
What is it? More Morganas?
No... but if we were to run into Morganas right now, that might be an even bigger problem.
What are you talking about?
He's talkin's 'bout meeeeee! *tumble* Oh, crap, mah knee! Ohhhhhh, ouch.

Fields.MenuText: What's wrong with her?
Is she sick or something?
Who... *sigh* who thought it was a good idea to let the Belle get drunk?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing is wrong with me, I'm perfect. And bored. Okay, I was really bored. Not so much anymore. Hehehe.
I don't... Yeah, I don't think I've ever gotten sick... Nope. I think I'd remember it. I guess I'm just lucky... I guess.
I'm... Okay, I'm drunk. I am willing to... *hiccup* Say yes to drinking.
She got into the lager we picked up in Germany. She downed half a dozen bottles in the galley before anyone noticed her.
Of course she did.
It was delicious! Yummy in my... mouth.
Put a lock on the rest.
I can go through walls. See?
And hide it. In the meanwhile, we'll just have to try and avoid any Morganas until she's a little more clear headed.
Morganas? I heard Morganas! I'm coming Morganas!
@BATTLE
Hey, St. Louis, do you see what I see?
Shhhhh. I'm resting my everything.
Head still throbbing? The first hangover is the worst.
Mhmmmm. *softly* Now... if you could leave me alone for a week, or a year... that'd be good.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, I was just going to point out the horizon, but if you're not interested...
I'm sorry, I couldn't hear you! Speak up, please!
But what about Hawaii?

Fields.DialogueText: Wait, what's that about the horizon? Describe it to me, I can't look, it's too bright.
Ouch! Shut up! Ouch... I hurt myself with my own words. Bad voice, you should know better.
Hawaii? Are we there? I was against it at first, but I could really use some R&R right about now.
Just squint toward the horizon and tell me what you see.
Ehhhh, I hate the sun... Is that land? Are we coming up to it?
We should be there before you know it.
The first thing I'm doing there is finding a nearby palm tree to nap under.
That's pretty unlike you, St. Louis.
Then when I wake up I'm gonna find me my dragon.
That's more like it.
@BATTLE
St. Louis? We've been expecting you.
Yes, we're here to bolster your defenses.
You don't gotta worry too much about Morganas with us around.
Well, we haven't had to worry too much regardless. I don't know where this fear of attack is coming from, but I guess it's better safe than sorry.
... You don't look Hawaiian.
St. Louis. Rude.
I'm not. I'm from Minnesota. Though I've been stationed here for the better part of a year now, I'd say.
And no Morgana attacks?
Only a handful.
Oh dammit, this is going to be so boooooring!

Fields.MenuText: Don't mind her, she's just... She's St. Louis.
I thought you wanted a little boring.
I'm not disagreeing, but shhhhh, rude!

Fields.DialogueText: By that he means I'm the best Belle in all the fleet. Wanna see what I can do with a coin? Watch this!
A little bit of boring. Not a buffet of boring served 24-7.
I'm St. Louis. I'm rude. Live with it!
Well, you two are certainly interesting. If nothing more, you're adding a little more color to our patrol.
*ALARM*
Speaking of, it sounds like Morganas now.
I hope there's more where that came from.
@BATTLE
Ignore her. She can flip that coin all day.
I see someone's getting comfortable with the island life.
I guess it has its perks.
I've never actually sunbathed before. It's kinda fun.

Fields.MenuText: You've never sunbathed before? What, are you afraid of daylight or something?
Well, be careful not to burn, wouldn't want to mess up that tan.
If I were you, I'd spend less time bathing in the sun and more time working.

Fields.DialogueText: I never had a chance, before. Don't be so insensitive, Captain. You're not a Belle. You don't know.
Psh, I doubt I'll tan. Though... I bet I'd look good with a tan. Hmmm...
I'm working just fine, Captain. See? I'm overseeing the rest of the crew, making sure they don't goof off.
Oh, that's right, before I forget, I was hoping you could do me a favor.
I'll decide after you tell me what the favor is.
I heard about a luau they were having on the beach, and I was hoping we could maybe get close enough that I might be able to join in. What do you think?
I mean, I can try, but I'm not sure how close would be too close.
That's all I can ask, I guess. Now let's kill some time with Morgana patrol.
@BATTLE
I can't believe we couldn't get closer. It's like torture being able to watch and not join in.
Hey, St. Louis, I got you something I think you'll like.
Is that food? Oh whoa, it smells delicious. Is all that for me?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, if you think you can eat all of it.
Well, I was actually hoping we could share, but if you're that hungry...
No.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, trust me, I can eat my body weight. And I mean the weight of the ship.
No, no, I mean, I am, but I'm not too greedy to share.
Rude sonuva---
I figured since I couldn't get you to the luau that I could try and bring some of it to you.
That's... thanks a lot, Cap. It really brings a tear... to my stomach, I'm starving! Gimme!
Hey, hey, here you go, just don't eat my hand.
As long as you get your hand out of my pig, there will be no bloodshed.
Heh, deal.
Man, after all this we better go find a Morgana for me to work off all this food on.
Shouldn't be hard. We're practically Morgana magnets, after all.
I know. That's just how I like it.
@BATTLE
Kidding, I'm not that rude.
Ummm, St. Louis, you know the Morganas are usually coming towards the island. You know, from the sea.
Uh, huh, I'm familiar with Morganas.
So why are you staring at the islands?
I'm not watching for Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: Then what are you watching for?
Why exactly not?
Do I need to remind you of why we're here?

Fields.DialogueText: What do you think? Dragons.
Because while Morganas would be coming from the sea, but dragons are far more likely to already be on land.
No. I know why we're here. I'm just multitasking. I can hunt for Morganas and dragons at the same time.
Dragons? Again with the dragons?
Always with the dragons. Until I'm wearing a dragon skin jacket with an awesome, like, fire motif!
All right... If we find a dragon and hunt it, we'll get you a jacket.
I like the sound of that. Deal!
But until then, please keep your eyes out for the Morganas, okay?
*raspberry* Fiiiine.
@BATTLE
All right, so if we stay on this course, instead of navigating between these two islands, we'll be safer as well as faster. When we reach this point we'll circle back to cover what we missed.
St. Louis? What are you doing in here?
I spend a lot of time in here. Why do you think this ship sails so smoothly?

Fields.MenuText: Magic?
I just have faith in my crew.
I guess I always took it for granted.

Fields.DialogueText: *scoff* Well, I guess I'm close enough.
Well, as a member of your crew, I thank you. But seriously, it's mostly me.
Well, you shouldn't. Everyone enjoys a thank you every once in a while.
So you're a navigator now?
I've always had a way with water. I just kind of understand how it thinks, I guess. You know what I mean?
Not so much.
No, I guess I'm just weird.
Well, judging by our voyage so far, I'm glad you're as weird as you are.
Heh, well... thanks, I guess.
*ALARM*
No matter how well I navigate, there's really no planning for them.
No, but we can still take care of them.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain, we are surrounded on all sides by Morganas!
All sides? We're in the harbor! What's going on?
The island is surrounded! It's gotta be like twenty or thirty of 'em!

Fields.MenuText: Too much for you?
We've had worse.
At least it's not a dragon.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess we're about to find out!
Really? When? I can't think of anything.
Oh, man, I wish it was a dragon. That'd be awesome!
*BOOM*
Captain, St. Louis, they're starting to bomb the island.
Are they attacking us too?
It looks like they're focusing on the island.
I guess we better draw a little fire then!
@BATTLE
Captain, Captain, are you seeing this!?
Seeing what? I'm a little busy here!
That Morgana right there, the massive one! It's a freaking dragon! Can't you see it, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: Y'know, if it makes you happy, sure.
I just see a wave of Morganas. Dragons can wait.
Looks more like a bull if you ask me.

Fields.DialogueText: Right?! This. Is the. Best day. Ever!
Dragons don't wait. It's not in their nature! We gotta take it out now!
Bulls don't have scales or breathe fire, Captain!
Dragon or not, we've still got Morganas to fight, St. Louis!
All right, well, let's start with that one then!
Whatever you say, St. Louis!
@BATTLE
Did that Morgana just breathe fire? It sprayed fire on us!
Put the ship out already! We need water!
We need a little breathing room to recover!
Uh, uh, uh, okay, I got it, Captain, we've got to move exactly as I say, okay?

Fields.MenuText: Do I look like I wanna die?
Fine, but I better not regret trusting you.
As long as you don't lead us straight into the dragon's mouth.

Fields.DialogueText: No, so then you better listen to me.
Do you regret anything about me? I'm perfect.
Actually we'll be going the opposite way. I don't wanna be dragon food either.
Now, look through the rocks!
The scary looking rocks that look like they're covered in blood?
Just go!
@BATTLE
Did you see that? How many Morganas do you think just crashed into those rocks?
Not enough, we've still got a "dragon" on our tail.
At least the fire is out. Let's see if one more strike will slay this dragon.
I see someone's having a good day.
That's right, you can all call me St. Louis, the dragon slayer!
All dragons shall fear me!

Fields.MenuText: I shall bow before our fearless leader!
Okay, get off the railings, you're making a scene.
It was a Morgana, not a dragon. You know that, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, please, get up, Captain. You're embarrassing me.
You can't make me. I'll make as many scenes as I want. Hell, I'll make a whole play.
It was a dragon. I don't care what you say.
You really are a lucky charm. We'd be in the water if it wasn't for you, St. Louis.
There's a reason we call her Lucky Lou.
You call me that? I've never heard that!
Lucky Lou... I like it.
No, it's St. Louis, the dragon slayer!
Whatever you say, Lucky Lou.
*growl*
We're not out of the woods yet. There are still some straggling Morganas left.
No need to fear. We're the crew of the Lucky Lou.
The dragon slayer!
@BATTLE
*exhale* Man, I am beat. That was exactly the kind of adventure I've been waiting for, Captain.
Plus, you got to slay your very own dragon.
The icing on top of the cake. Do you think you might be able to patrol without me for a while. I'm feeling like taking a veeeery long nap.

Fields.MenuText: Unfortunately for your nap time, we kind of need you.
Sure, go ahead. I'll try not to wake you.
Sorry, but you're gonna have to suck it up. You can sleep when the Morganas sleep.

Fields.DialogueText: Need is a strong word, I think you just want me.
Aw, so sweet, Captain. Be careful, or I might think you're getting soft on me.
But the Morganas never sleep.
Heh, that's the captain I begrudgingly respect and adore.
Honestly, I'm a fan of yours as well. Who doesn't like Lucky Lou.
Oh, I really hope that name doesn't stick.
Trust me, it will.
You can be a pain in my neck, Captain.
Then get out of my office and get back to watching for Morganas.
Fine, I'll do just that. Pbbbth. See you out there.
See you, Lucky Lou.
*growl* I hate you.
Either way, you're staying up.
I'll toughen up. No sleep for you.
I know.
